page.title: 19RAG MARKET
page.content: Named after the parish church of St.Martin in the Bull Ring,built by the De Bermingham family in the 13th century,Birmingham's famous Rag Market is held in this building.The "Rag Alley"is famous for its bargains.For example:Christian Dior fancy stockings can be bought for 30p a pair,and one can buy eight pairs of tights for #1. Traders from as far away as Nottingham,Derby and Manchester occupy stalls in the "Rag Tag" each market day.They can do this because of the city's good position in the heart of the motorway network.There are over 560 stalls,displaying new and secondhand goods of all descriptions. Until recently,the Rag market shared the building with the secondary Horticultural Wholesale Traders and the Farmers and Growers who now occupy a new Wholesale Markets Precinct.
